name: Ottley's Plantation Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The plantation is magnificent, the food was incredible, the accomodations just perfect. But....it was the people who made this an absolutely wonderful experience. From the moment we were greeted by Marty at the airport, to the warm hugs and heartfelt good wishes when we finally had to say goodbye, we felt as if we were with long time friends. Everyone went out of their way to insure that our every need was met, from the tour of the island with Chiefy, to the baseball scores given by Art, the amazing wait staff at every meal, and to everyone in the office. This was the most difficult place to leave because we felt so much at home. I think that is the best compliment I could ever give to any resort and is really an amazing accomplishent by the many caring and wonderful people at Ottley's.
reviews.title: Ottley's not only met but exceeded our expectations!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After 5 years of secret hoarding, I surprised my wife with a pre-15th Anniversary/pre-40th Birthday trip to the Caribbean. This was our first time to the Islands, and our first real vacation together since our honeymoon. After doing a little research, we settled on Ottley's as the place we wanted to be. . . and what a GREAT decision that was!
reviews.title: Absolutely fantastic place to experience the Caribbean for the first time!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From the initial contact I had in December when setting up the trip to the moment we said our goodbyes at the end of our stay, every contact we had with the folks at Ottley's was positive! There were too many folk to remember, but special kudos to Janice and Janelle who served our breakfasts and dinners respectively (they were unfailingly polite and efficient and always took the time to make sure we had all that we needed--thanks for the extra servings of bread!!), Marty who always took the time to chat with us and made sure to steer us to some really cool places, and most especially to King Arthur the master of the house, whose witticisms and anecdotes always made for interesting conversation, and without whom there would be no Camelot! I can honestly say that in our time there we never really felt like "guests", but more like family friends!
reviews.title: A Great Inn with an Even Greater Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Upon our arrival we were warmly greeted with smiles, kind words, as well as 2 Calypso Coolers. As we were being shown to our villa, we were treated to a spectacular view of the Atlantic complete with waving palms and gorgeous tropical flowers along with some of the neighboring islands visible in the distance.
reviews.title: We experienced spectacular views, fabulous food, and gracious staff during our stay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our villa was spacious and comfortable. The plunge pool was a great feature and oh so comfy at pretty much any hour, and if we were a little cool then jumping into the whirlpool bath took care of that! Whether in the plunge pool or inside the villa with the doors open, we were treated to the ocean view and the kiss of the tradewinds! The villa was always kept clean with the nightly turn-down service a luxury we were not used to! We were comfortable with using only the ceiling fan, but ac was available if we ever felt the need. The bed was big and comfy and sleep was no problem . . . once we became used to the level of noise the native fauna (especially the frogs) made! But that had it's own seperate charm, and it was quite pleasant to fall asleep to their sound along with that of the rain showers passing by.
reviews.title: Lush and Tropical with great service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at Ottley's for 4 nights - very pleasant, relaxing and particularly nice if you have one of the cottages with a spacious veranda and good views over the gardens down to the sea a couple of miles away.
reviews.title: DELIGHTFUL, SPACIOUS AND QUIET

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: With a through flight twice a week from London on BA (with a brief touchdown at Antigua) getting to Ottleys is straightforward. There's a warm welcome, good food, and the rare pleasure these days of being at a hotel where the owners are present and very hands-on.
reviews.title: Restful Retreat in the Clouds

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hire a car for a day, and explore St Kitts. It's a couple of hours drive around the island, plus stops for the historic Brimstone Hill Fortress and gardens and for the small town Basseterre which is where the car hire company will take you to from the hotel to sign up and actually give you the car.
reviews.title: Lovely- The best place I have ever stayed on a vacation.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Probably best to combine St Kitts with another island - but don't bother with St Barths, the allegedly glamorous and gorgeous French island - far too busy, too much traffic on narrow roads and tres, tres cher.........
reviews.title: Simply Awesome

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Ottley’s Plantation had a tough act to follow, since we arrived for a 3-night stay after 4 nights at Nisbet Plantation on Nevis, to which we’d gone for a return visit. Of course, I wouldn’t be comparing apples to apples, since Ottley’s is on a different island, and is located inland, in the mountains, rather than on the beach. Happily, our visit was equally satisfying, albeit different.
reviews.title: Extraordinary accomodations, food, and service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After a lot of thought I finally decided the only two things I could think of that fell short of absolute perfection at Ottley’s were the challenging driveway in off the main road and the fact that there were no pepper mills on the tables. And I’m sure if I had thought to request a peppermill at my table it would have arrived there at each meal for the balance of our stay.
reviews.title: We couldn't have felt more like royalty

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What an absolutely magnificent place to spend your vacation time! The accommodations were superb (we had one of the “Royal Suite cottages” which was roomy, immaculate, well laid-out, and a wonderful, relaxing view. The room had a private plunge pool—which was a great way to start and end each day.
reviews.title: The most heavenly, friendly and relaxing place we've ever stayed in

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The buildings and grounds are fabulous—beautiful to look at, very well maintained, and wonderful to be around.
reviews.title: Scrumptious food, delightful staff, gorgeous grounds

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Each of the meals (we had a multi-day, multi-meal plan) was a joy to look at and a bigger joy to consume. Simply terrific food start-to-finish, every meal.
reviews.title: Superb location, attentive staff and personable hosts

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: My wife took advantage of the massage services and was completely satisfied with the experience and its results.
reviews.title: Tranquility and beauty

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a large group visit St. Kitts in August 2010 and we all stayed at Ottley's Plantation Inn. The hospitatility at Ottley's was incredible, the staff knew everyone's name from the first day and made our group's experience so amazing. The restaurant at Ottley's was exceptional and I have never tasted anything that even compares to what Ottley's served. When we told Karen and Nancy (two of the owners) that some people in our group did not drink, they removed all alcohol from their mini bars and were never offered a wine list or alcoholic beverage. It was the little details that the staff at Ottley's did to make our stay so incredibly special. I would highly recommend Ottley's Plantation Inn to anyone looking to spend a relaxing vacation in the Carribean!
reviews.title: Tropical paradise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What can we say? We were absolutely astounded by this place. From the moment we arrived until the moment we departed for Nevis we felt like we had been accepted into a family and were well cared for. We stayed at Ottleys as part of a tri-centre holiday: St Kitts, Nevis and Barbados. It was our first visit to Ottleys and had arranged our own trip, not through a travel agent. We had not realised that we had to let them know when we would be arriving. We arrived via Barbados, (not the conventional way Antigua) and arrived late. The hotel had made sure that there was somebody there at the airport staying for us until we arrived. The welcome cocktail from Marcus was gorgeous. We stayed in a villa with a plunge pool, which we would highly recommend. The bar was re-stocked daily and the maid servicing and turn down service was the most discrete and professional. Our villa had a wonderful view over to the ocean and on a clear day you can see neighbouring islands. The hotel is situate at the foot of the volcano and is in extensive and very, very well cared for grounds, with a spa, a tennis court and a forest trail. Try the couples' massage at the spa - there is an amazing view overlooking the rainforest. Also, watch out for the monkeys. Watch out for King Arthur, one of the owners and listen to his tales. All meals and drinks were fabulous. The fluffiest pancakes ever are at Ottleys. Make sure you are there on a Sunday for Champagne Brunch. We hired a car for a week, but with hindsight, this was too long as we were expecting better beaches and a little bit more to see on the island. The St Kitts scenic railway was good. We were disappointed that the beaches were not very good at all, but Ottleys was brilliant and is highly recommended.
reviews.title: One word - serenity

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Whilst not for everyone I will be returning. Was it the fantastic views, the friendly staff, the lovely rooms, the amazing grounds, the superb food, the fantastic owners, well, I reckon a combination of all of these gave us a holiday we really wanted. To be in a luxurious environment and cared for and pampered with friendly service by staff who listen was just what we wanted.
reviews.title: It was more than we had hoped for

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The ability to watch monkeys in their habitat was an added plus too. I'm struggling to find an area of improvement.Our room with the plunge pool was extremely clean and well stocked with towels. There was ample space for everything we brought with us, and the bed was very, very large and comfortable.
reviews.title: awesome scenery, great rooms/Villas, good food

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If one fancied some activity there was croquet and a tennis court in the grounds - I saw both but preferred to read or swim, or have another drink/something to eat.
reviews.title: Felt like I was in The Great Gatsby

description: Originally a 17th century sugar plantation, Ottley's Plantation Inn transports guests to a bygone era of gracious living, hospitality and elegance. Situated at the foot of majestic Mt. Liamuiga overlooking the Atlantic Ocean, the 35 acre Ottley's Plantation Inn is a magnificent hideaway. Enjoy swimming in the 66' spring feed pool as well as the Mango Orchard Spa Retreat. Ottley's Plantation has been beautifully renovated to preserve its aura of colonial grandeur and graciousness while adding the modern luxuries desired by today's discerning traveler.
